meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a process that, given sufficient time, will visit all states in a system.
meanings.sent1: The ergodic system eventually explores every possibility.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ergodic nature of the experiment over time.
meanings.sent3: The ergodic behavior of the bouncing ball amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered in an ergodic journey through memories.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush moved ergodically across the canvas, covering every inch.

meanings.definition: Denoting a system or process that has the same statistical properties when observed at different times.
meanings.sent1: An ergodic process shows consistent statistical behavior.
meanings.sent2: The financial analyst analyzed the ergodic trends in the market data.
meanings.sent3: The ergodic pattern of the stock market surprised the investors.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions followed an ergodic pattern, always returning to the same state.
meanings.sent5: The music played ergodically, with each note repeating in a predictable sequence.
